content:
• Monday, April 1, 2013
  • SCVL

    Shoe Carnival (NASDAQ:SCVL) Q4 comes in line with estimates, but net earnings slipped 2% as the...

    Shoe Carnival (NASDAQ:SCVL) Q4 comes in line with estimates, but net earnings slipped 2% as the footwear retailer reported higher input costs and general expenses which offset improved sales. The company also guides its Q1 below analyst expectations, citing a slow start to its spring selling season. It now expects to earn between $0.36 to $0.44 on net sales of $226M to $232M. Analysts were looking for $0.57 on $240M, respectively. Shares -1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:03 PM
  • HUM

    The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, after originally calling for reducing Medicare...

    The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services, after originally calling for reducing Medicare Advantage payments in February, seem to have reversed course, now projecting that combined growth in Medicare Advantage rates and fee-for-service rates will be 3.3%. Though it's unclear precisely what that may mean for health insurers, the markets are taking it as a positive: HUM +9%, AET +2.3%, WCG +4.1%, UNH +4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:12 PM | 3 Comments
  • BIOF

    BioFuel Energy (NASDAQ:BIOF): Q4 EPS of -$1.89. Revenue of $84.9M. (PR)

    BioFuel Energy (NASDAQ:BIOF): Q4 EPS of -$1.89. Revenue of $84.9M. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM
  • BGCP

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BGCP +43%. HUM +9%. NUAN +6%. AMSC +6%. UNH +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BGCP +43%. HUM +9%. NUAN +6%. AMSC +6%. UNH +4%.
    After-hours top losers: NAT -6%. OTC:ATLS -3%. CECO -3%. SCVL -3%. IMN -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • NUAN

    Nuance (NASDAQ:NUAN) +9% AH on news Carl Icahn has amassed a 9.3% stake. Is Icahn looking to...

    Nuance (NASDAQ:NUAN) +9% AH on news Carl Icahn has amassed a 9.3% stake. Is Icahn looking to make an activist push? Nuance's acquisition-fueled growth strategy has received some criticism over the years.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM | 10 Comments
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tankers (NYSE:NAT) -7% AH after announcing a public offering of $87M aggregate...

    Nordic American Tankers (NYSE:NAT) -7% AH after announcing a public offering of $87M aggregate amount of common shares. Net proceeds from the offering are expected to be used to pay for acquisitions under NAT's expansion program, including the Nordic Future, and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM | 3 Comments
  • BGCP

    BGC Partners (NASDAQ:BGCP) soars after the closing bell on Nasdaq OMX acquisition of eSpeed...

    BGC Partners (NASDAQ:BGCP) soars after the closing bell on Nasdaq OMX acquisition of eSpeed Treasury trading platform. Shares +51% AH, Nasdaq OMX shares flat. 
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMSC

    American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) +5.8% AH after stating it expects to report FQ4 (ended...

    American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) +5.8% AH after stating it expects to report FQ4 (ended yesterday) revenue of $19M-$20M. That's above prior guidance of $18M, but only in-line with a $20M consensus. Perhaps more importantly, AMSC says it expects to "achieve positive net cash flows on a quarterly basis" by the end of FY14 (ends March '14), while adding it would need to be on a $180M-$190M/year revenue run rate to achieve this goal. AMSC's FY14 revenue consensus stands at $102.5M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • SCLN

    SciClone (NASDAQ:SCLN): Q4 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $33.4M misses by $1.9M....

    SciClone (NASDAQ:SCLN): Q4 EPS of $0.03 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $33.4M misses by $1.9M. Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • HUM

    Health insurers surge into the close as the final notice on Medicare Advantage reimbursement is...

    Health insurers surge into the close as the final notice on Medicare Advantage reimbursement is due today: Humana (HUM +8.6%), UnitedHealth (UNH +3.1%), Wellcare Healthplans (WCG +3.9%), Coventry Health (CVH +1%) Centene (CNC +1%) and Aetna (AET +2.5%).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • DSCI

    Derma Sciences (DSCI +3.5%) holds firmly in the green today despite a weak market, after beating...

    Derma Sciences (DSCI +3.5%) holds firmly in the green today despite a weak market, after beating on its Q4 report this morning. The firm posted a loss of $0.27, down 17% Y/Y, but beating consensus estimates for a $0.31 loss. Revenue was higher than the prior year period however, up 22% at $20.1M and topping analysts' estimates of $19.73M as sales continue to improve.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone Systems (PAY +2.4%) looks like a P-E target with shares off sharply this year and the...

    VeriFone Systems (PAY +2.4%) looks like a P-E target with shares off sharply this year and the company without a permanent CEO in place to block a takeover. A private buyer could take advantage of the company's steady cash flow and look to expand into new services, according to analysts. The Street's take on PAY: "The vultures are circling."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • KWK

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK +14.2%) delivered on its promise to partially monetize its Barnett...

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK +14.2%) delivered on its promise to partially monetize its Barnett Shale interest, Jefferies analysts say, but it still needs a Horn River JV to support the firm's Hold rating and $2.50 price target. While KWK will want to use the sale proceeds to pay down more than $1B in 2015-16 notes, banks likely will request KWK pay down some of its $388M of bank debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • BVX

    Bovie Medical (BVX +14%) surges today after the company beat Q4 estimates earlier, $0.02 per...

    Bovie Medical (BVX +14%) surges today after the company beat Q4 estimates earlier, $0.02 per share, compared with a loss of $0.05 in the same period a year earlier, with revenue rising to $6.8M and beating consensus forecasts of $6.1M. The company also said discussions are ongoing with a large medical devices company on a developmental and manufacturing agreement. The company first released news of a potential deal in March last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • QTWW

    Quantum Fuel Systems Technologies (QTWW +2.6%) gains today after announcing it's received a...

    Quantum Fuel Systems Technologies (QTWW +2.6%) gains today after announcing it's received a purchase contract and signed a vehicle development and production agreement with an unnamed leading global automaker to engineer and develop a natural gas storage and engine fuel system for an advanced internal combustion engine vehicle.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 5 Comments
  • ELX

    Emulex (ELX +3.5%) has reached a deal with activist investor Elliott Associates, which has...

    Emulex (ELX +3.5%) has reached a deal with activist investor Elliott Associates, which has amassed a double-digit stake in the struggling storage adapter card/switch maker. In exchange for expanding its board to include two Elliott-backed directors - Eugene J. Frantz and Gregory S. Clark - Elliott has agreed not to wage a proxy battle for the sale of the company until March 2014, to wage other proxy contests until Aug. '13, or to raise its stake above 15%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • IDRA

    Idera Pharmaceuticals (IDRA +3.5%) moves up today after announcing earlier that it's completed...

    Idera Pharmaceuticals (IDRA +3.5%) moves up today after announcing earlier that it's completed dosing in Phase 1 trials of IMO-8400, currently in clinical development for the treatment of autoimmune diseases. In addition, the company says that its protocol for a Phase 2 study in patients with psoriasis has received “no objection” clearance from the Competent Authority of the Netherlands.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • VEDL

    Sterlite Industries (SLT -5.4%) says state regulators in India ordered it to shut a copper...

    Sterlite Industries (SLT -5.4%) says state regulators in India ordered it to shut a copper smelter over allegations of a gas leak, in a move that could spur imports and drive up regional premiums for the metal. The smelter is India's biggest, producing more than 300K metric tons/year to supply half the country's domestic copper needs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • DQ

    Disappointing Q4 results from Daqo (DQ -9.8%), together with a general decline in risk assets,...

    Disappointing Q4 results from Daqo (DQ -9.8%), together with a general decline in risk assets, fuels a rout in solar names. YGE -7.9%. SOL -7.3%. JKS -5.4%. GTAT -4.1%. CSIQ -4.9%. SPWR -2.8%. WFR -2.5%. Daqo's Q4 revenue of $6.2M represented a 77% Y/Y drop, and was well below the $14.5M forecast by the one analyst providing estimates. Gross margin was -178.5% (no typo), a little worse than Q3's -51.1%. Polysilicon output is expected to total 720 MT in Q1, up from Q4's 592 MT.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +4.8%) gets a lift today after saying earlier that a manuscript on...

    Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD +4.8%) gets a lift today after saying earlier that a manuscript on the development and validation of the Company's microRNA-based diagnostic assay for the classification of renal cell tumors has been accepted for publication by Molecular Oncology.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • EBAY

    eBay (EBAY +3.7%) reportedly leads a $50M funding round for Snapdeal, a fast-growing Indian...

    eBay (EBAY +3.7%) reportedly leads a $50M funding round for Snapdeal, a fast-growing Indian e-commerce marketplace that now claims 20M users and is expected to handle ~$400M in transactions this year. Relative to China, where Alibaba has grown into a colossus, India's e-commerce penetration rates are still low. Meanwhile, sell-side praise continues to pour in for eBay's analyst day (previous). Baird and Cantor are pleased with eBay's strong margin forecasts for PayPal, in light of digital wallet fee concerns. (analyst day slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • KOOL

    ThermoGenesis (KOOL -3.5%) slides in spite of its earlier announcement of an order for its AXP...

    ThermoGenesis (KOOL -3.5%) slides in spite of its earlier announcement of an order for its AXP AutoXpress System from Crioestaminal, a leading cord blood stem cell bank located in Portugal. Terms of the deal were not disclosed. The AXP System is an automated device with companion sterile blood processing disposables for harvesting cord blood stem cells in closed systems. Crioestaminal is considered a major European cord blood bank.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • AMRN

    Amarin (AMRN +1%) gets a boost from some positive commentary out of Leerink Swann today, saying...

    Amarin (AMRN +1%) gets a boost from some positive commentary out of Leerink Swann today, saying that Vascepa's prescription data appears to be tracking well. The firm notes that the largest TRx advance since the drug's launch was recorded last week, and the number of new prescriptions and refills are growing. Looking forward, Leerink thinks the AMRN's ramped-up marketing efforts and moves to obtain Tier 2 reimbursement should further accelerate TRx growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • RJETQ

    Airline stocks (NYSEARCA:FAA) trade are blowing off some steam with regional carriers Republic...

    Airline stocks (NYSEARCA:FAA) trade are blowing off some steam with regional carriers Republic Airways (RJET -9.8%), Allegiant (ALGT -3%), and Spirit Airlines (SAVE -3.2%) leading the slide. Macroeconomic concerns and a harsh downgrade from Evercore Partners on United Continental (UAL -2.5%) seem to be tipping sentiment.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • TVIAQ

    Solazyme (SZYM -1.8%) has done a sharp about-face since popping nearly 6% at the open after a...

    Solazyme (SZYM -1.8%) has done a sharp about-face since popping nearly 6% at the open after a Motley Fool article praised the company's management on Sunday. The Fool notes: "Keeping the streak of milestone accomplishments alive rests squarely on these leaders' shoulders. If I were an investor here, I'd feel pretty good about that."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 4 Comments
  • SEII

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT -10.9%) asks to delay its 10-K after its accounting firm fails to make...

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT -10.9%) asks to delay its 10-K after its accounting firm fails to make a timely filing; CLNT says it knows of no unresolved issues concerning its 2012 financial statements. CLNT discloses 2012 expectations: Revenues of ~$57M vs. ~$55M for 2011, income from operations of $6.3M vs. $8.2M last year, EPS of $1.58 vs. $2.30 for 2011.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • ARNA

    Shares in Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -2.2%) turn south this morning, shrugging off an earlier...

    Shares in Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA -2.2%) turn south this morning, shrugging off an earlier announcement of a $500K milestone payment from Eisai on the submission of a marketing authorization application for Belviq with regulatory authorities in Mexico. About 30% of adults in Mexico are obese and 70% are overweight or obese, which the company says is leading to a significant health and economic burden in the country.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural's (HNR -5.4%) target price is cut to $3 from $11 at Wunderlich, which says the...

    Harvest Natural's (HNR -5.4%) target price is cut to $3 from $11 at Wunderlich, which says the market underestimated the end of its pending Venezuelan asset sale while overreacting to accounting issues. HNR continues to be a "binary mover going forward, considering our range of potential outcomes."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • CYTK

    Cytokinetics (CYTK -1.8%) says it's begun a first-time-in-humans, Phase I clinical trial of...

    Cytokinetics (CYTK -1.8%) says it's begun a first-time-in-humans, Phase I clinical trial of CK-2127107, a potential treatment for improving skeletal muscle function in diseases and medical conditions associated with neuromuscular dysfunction, muscular weakness, and/or muscle fatigue.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • BB

    A positive note from Wells Fargo helps BlackBerry (BBRY +4.2%) outperform after closing down...

    A positive note from Wells Fargo helps BlackBerry (BBRY +4.2%) outperform after closing down slightly in the wake of Friday's FQ4 report. Wells thinks BlackBerry can post FQ1 EPS of $0.07, above guidance of breakeven, on the back of 3.5M BB10 shipments and a 24% hardware gross margin. FBR, meanwhile, is maintaining an Underperform, but lifting its PT to $11 from $6.50. Noting FQ4 revenue, device sales, and sub losses were worse than expected even as margins and EPS beat estimates, the firm thinks BlackBerry "could struggle to generate a consistent operating profit."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 8 Comments
  • AM-OLD

    American Greetings (AM-OLD +12%) soars after agreeing to be taken private at $18.20 per share by...

    American Greetings (AM-OLD +12%) soars after agreeing to be taken private at $18.20 per share by a group led the the Weiss family. The deal price is a 26.9% improvement over an original offer put together by the group last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • CALL

    After a lengthy delay, magicJack VocalTec (CALL +6.1%) announces it will deliver its Q4 report...

    After a lengthy delay, magicJack VocalTec (CALL +6.1%) announces it will deliver its Q4 report after tomorrow's close. That's fueling a rally in shares of the VoIP hardware/service provider, which has become a favorite of shorts (40.6% of the float shorted as of March 15) amidst widespread scrutiny of its accounting/business practices. The WSJ recently observed magicJack's use of put sales to fund its buyback program may have begun backfiring thanks to a declining stock price.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 3 Comments
  • ACER

    Shares of Opexa Therapeutics (OPXA -5.6%) slides after reporting disappointing FY12 results late...

    Shares of Opexa Therapeutics (OPXA -5.6%) slides after reporting disappointing FY12 results late Thursday, just prior to the long weekend. The company posted a full year net loss of $8.9M versus a loss of $5.97M for 2011, due partly to increased research and other expenses. Additionally, this morning the drug developer announces some changes to its senior managment team, appointing Karthik Radhakrishnan as CFO, Kenny Frazier as VP of Clinical Development and Regulatory Affairs and Maryann Murray as Clinical Development Manager.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • TSLA

    SolarCity (SCTY +1.7%) trades higher after announcing it has been added to the Russell 2000 and...

    SolarCity (SCTY +1.7%) trades higher after announcing it has been added to the Russell 2000 and 3000 indexes. Shares are up 61% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • GME

    Short sellers are having a tough day with a trio of their favorite targets as Tesla Motors,...

    Short sellers are having a tough day with a trio of their favorite targets as Tesla Motors, GameStop (GME +5%), and SodaStream (SODA +2.7%) all break higher. Tesla bulls are giddy with news of a profitable quarter while GameStop nabbed a price target increase from Baird and SodaStream continues to garner interest with the company's fundamentals looking stronger.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • HES

    Hess (HES +1.9%) agrees to sell its Russian subsidary Samara-Nafta to Lukoil for total...

    Hess (HES +1.9%) agrees to sell its Russian subsidary Samara-Nafta to Lukoil for total consideration of $2.05B; based on its 90% interest in the subsidiary, after-tax proceeds to HES are expected to total ~$1.8B. Samara-Nafta is currently producing 50K boe/day in the Volga-Urals region of Russia. So far in 2013, HES has announced or completed ~$3.4B in asset sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    More on Vringo: Maxim's John Tinker is out with a bullish report. Tinker, who maintains a $10...

    More on Vringo: Maxim's John Tinker is out with a bullish report. Tinker, who maintains a $10 PT, thinks Microsoft could buy Vringo to help pursue an infringement case against Google, and estimates the net proceeds from a legal win against Microsoft could amount to $0.73/share. He also thinks Vringo could settle with ZTE to prove its cash-generating ability, and estimates a "reasonable value" of $2.87/share for a Google win. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM | 4 Comments
  • MU

    Disgruntled Elpida creditors are appealing a Tokyo District Court's Feb. 28 approval of Micron's...

    Disgruntled Elpida creditors are appealing a Tokyo District Court's Feb. 28 approval of Micron's (MU -2%) purchase of the bankrupt Japanese DRAM maker. Micron, which still needs the Tokyo court to finalize its approval order and a Delaware bankruptcy court to sign off on the deal, says the appeal process will take roughly 3-4 months. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 1 Comment
  • PCRFY

    Shares of Panasonic (PC -8.6%) slump with the electronics firm reportedly under investigation by...

    Shares of Panasonic (PC -8.6%) slump with the electronics firm reportedly under investigation by U.S. authorities on charges of bribery. The company plans to delist its American depositary shares from the NYSE on April 22.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • P

    Pandora (P -1.9%) slides in the wake of The Verge's report about Apple's hopes for a summertime...

    Pandora (P -1.9%) slides in the wake of The Verge's report about Apple's hopes for a summertime iRadio launch, and the music industry's "love-hate relationship" with Pandora. Shares remain up 51% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • SNFCA

    Security National Financial (SNFCA +23%) soars after reporting a big jump in income in Q4 and...

    Security National Financial (SNFCA +23%) soars after reporting a big jump in income in Q4 and seemingly taking at the shorts. "We are aware ... of the large short position that evidenced itself in our stock at year end." The company, says the CEO, had over $40M in cash or equivalents at year end and plans to put it to work. "Profitability should improve." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +5.4%) adds to the big gains it saw on Friday on Microsoft settlement hopes after...

    Vringo (VRNG +5.4%) adds to the big gains it saw on Friday on Microsoft settlement hopes after announcing it has filed a fresh suit against ZTE, this time in France. Vringo, which sued ZTE in the U.K. and Germany last year, alleges the Chinese OEM is infringing "the French part" of two Vringo EU patents.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • TSLA

    "I wanted to reach out to ask a favor," begins an e-mail sent last week by a senior exec at...

    "I wanted to reach out to ask a favor," begins an e-mail sent last week by a senior exec at Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) to potential customers asking them to quickly turn in their paperwork in the last week of the quarter to help the company become profitable. Though it's not the first time an automaker has become hyper-aggressive in trying to stoke up extra sales before the end of a reporting period, it could be an indication that some Q2 Model S sales were pulled forward into Q1. Shares of TSLA are rocketing higher premarket, up 15.2% to $43.66

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM | 26 Comments
  • KWK

    Premarket gainers: KWK +33%. BCRX +30%. SNFCA +23%. TSLA +16%. AM-OLD +12%. VRNG +10%. PAL +6%.

    Premarket gainers: KWK +33%. BCRX +30%. SNFCA +23%. TSLA +16%. AM-OLD +12%. VRNG +10%. PAL +6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • NTR

    Potash (POT) +1.6% premarket after J.P. Morgan upgrades shares to Overweight from Neutral with a...

    Potash (POT) +1.6% premarket after J.P. Morgan upgrades shares to Overweight from Neutral with a $45 price target, as prospects for volume growth have improved since the end of 2012. While earnings have fallen since 2011 and POT has generated little free cash flow due to substantial investments to increase its potash capacity, the firm believes the long period of capital investment is coming to an end.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • GIS

    Morgan Stanley downgrades General Mills (NYSE:GIS) to Equal-Weight from Overweight on a...

    Morgan Stanley downgrades General Mills (NYSE:GIS) to Equal-Weight from Overweight on a valuation call after shares rang up a 22% Q1 gain. The firm sees sluggish progress in key categories. GIS -0.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • KWK

    Quicksilver Resources (NYSE:KWK) +22.3% premarket following its agreement to sell a 25% interest...

    Quicksilver Resources (NYSE:KWK) +22.3% premarket following its agreement to sell a 25% interest in its Barnett shale assets for $485M to TG Barnett Resources, a U.S. subsidiary of Tokyo Gas. KWK will remain as operator of the assets. The proceeds - 25% higher than KWK's market cap - will help in the company's quest to pay down a heavy debt load.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM
  • CLF

    "You guys are soooo wrong," J.P. Morgan's Mike Gambardella scolds peers at Morgan Stanley and...

    "You guys are soooo wrong," J.P. Morgan's Mike Gambardella scolds peers at Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs for recent downgrades of Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF), as he adds the stock to its Focus List and foresees $40 by year's end. Fears of an imminent collapse in seaborne iron ore prices are overblown, he says, and positive earnings revisions could bring a short-covering rally. CLF +2.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM | 7 Comments
  • GMCR

    Keybanc raises its price target on Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) to $70 from $55...

    Keybanc raises its price target on Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) to $70 from $55 after channel checks show that pricing is holding steady despite the emergence of new private labels in the space. GMCR +1.1% to $57.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:58 AM | 4 Comments
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) roar 5.5% higher after the EV automaker announces that...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA) roar 5.5% higher after the EV automaker announces that February sales beat its own guidance and that it will be mildly profitable for Q1. What to watch: Though TSLA shorts could get thrashed around a bit on today's news, there's still the meaning of Elon Musk's cryptic tweet from last week to hash out with the company due to make another announcement tomorrow.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM | 2 Comments
